tool.name: OTB.HaralickTextureExtraction
tool.description: Computes Haralick textural features on the selected channel of the input image
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.HaralickTextureExtraction in $in channel $channel step $step ram $ram parameters.xrad $parameters.xrad parameters.yrad $parameters.yrad parameters.xoff $parameters.xoff parameters.yoff $parameters.yoff parameters.min $parameters.min parameters.max $parameters.max parameters.nbbin $parameters.nbbin texture $texture out $out prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: in
param.label: The input image to compute the features on.
param.help: The input image to compute the features on. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: tiff, jpeg, png

param.name: step
param.label: Step (in pixels) to compute output texture values. The first computed pixel position is shifted by (step-1)/2 in both directions.
param.help: Step (in pixels) to compute output texture values. The first computed pixel position is shifted by (step-1)/2 in both directions.

param.name: out
param.label: Output image containing the selected texture features.
param.help: Output image containing the selected texture features.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_out
param.label: Output image containing the selected texture features.
param.help: Output image containing the selected texture features.

tool.help: This application computes three sets of Haralick features [1][2]. * simple:Â a set of 8 local Haralick features: Energy (texture uniformity) , Entropy (measure of randomness of intensity image), Correlation (how correlated a pixel is to its neighborhood), Inverse Difference Moment (measures the texture homogeneity), Inertia (intensity contrast between a pixel and its neighborhood), Cluster Shade, Cluster Prominence, Haralick Correlation; * advanced: a set of 10 advanced Haralick features : Mean, Variance (measures the texture heterogeneity), Dissimilarity, Sum Average, Sum Variance, Sum Entropy, Difference of Entropies, Difference of Variances, IC1, IC2; * higher: a set of 11 higher Haralick features : Short Run Emphasis (measures the texture sharpness), Long Run Emphasis (measures the texture roughness), Grey-Level Nonuniformity, Run Length Nonuniformity, Run Percentage (measures the texture sharpness homogeneity), Low Grey-Level Run Emphasis, High Grey-Level Run Emphasis, Short Run Low Grey-Level Emphasis, Short Run High Grey-Level Emphasis, Long Run Low Grey-Level Emphasis and Long Run High Grey-Level Emphasis.
